answers.answer: Are they giving you a large enough doses of RAI? The protocol is with each dose, RAI is doubled from the last dose.  Also, it is said that up to 5 RAIs are considered safe.Have you had a recent uptake and scan.Are you on thyroid meds.You might think about going for a second opinion beings your present endo. is at a loss. However, chose an endo. who treats many thyroid patients per year.  They are very hard to come by because most deal with diabetes with thyroid down their list of expertise.You didn't say what your thyroid diagnose was, so I am reluctant to say more.Good luck

Thanks for getting back to my question each time I have had the treatments the have up it 50 mCrs. My first time it was 100, next 150, and this last time was 200. Yes I had a uptake and scan after the test. showing the remninents left in the neck area. I also have diabetes too. My thyroid cancer is Follicular-Papillary cancer.ancestrytreemom

question: I recently had my third round of radiation (R-131) 197mCr back around the end of July. Had my four month check-up  my blood test came back T-4 free 1.5, TSH 3rd  generation 0.03 L. Thyroglobulin Panel was Antibodies <20, and Thyrogloblin 16.2 My last Thyrogloblin level before the radiation was 28. I have been dealing with this for two years now. My endo has try to be aggressive with it but she is at her wits end too. Any comments or thoughts would be appreciatedThanksancestytreemom
title: What do I do now? Very Confused and scared?
